title: Electroporation based Technologies and Treatments

author: Damijan Miklavčič, Fakulteta za elektrotehniko, Univerza v Ljubljani

segmentation: Some time ago today very very interesting experience and I want to share this with you because.
As we can all witness.
We are not very crowded in this room.
OK, and I don't think it's important how many people is present in the room.
I think it's important that the right people are in the room.

I was attending a conference in Madrid.

I'm happy enough to know Eberhard Norman, and he was also a guest in our lab in last year, spending half a year.
In our lab now, if you sell to the electric field.
The membrane.
Undergoes changes which can be of transient nature.
Anne.
Then they are manifested in a way that you get things.
Across the membrane.
Otherwise don't cross the membrane so this can be used either to insert proteins into the cell membrane to introduce small or large molecules, even as large as as plasmid DNA.
You can make cells fuse.
After exposure to this electric field, or you can actually induce so severe damages to the membrane that the cell membrane is destructed and the the cell is lysed.
Now all these applications, as you will see.
Some of them already.
Are used in in a clinical practice, but some are on their way to be used either in biotechnology, biology, or.
In medicine now.

And if these are bacterial cells, then of course you can produce the plasma.
You can insert protein in proteins into the cell membrane.
This was demonstrated on blood cells.
You can make cells fused.

This was demonstrated both in vitro and in vivo already.
You can use genes.

Interfere with the functioning of the cells.

Ways how introduce genes for for the future.
Gene therapy.

Branches of this research is is transdermal drug delivery, because nobody wants really to to eat the pills or to be injected.

Skin of electric chemotherapy.

Published.

Enter clinical study was that within?
Within 171 nodules which were treated locally by electric chemotherapy.

85% responded objectively, which means that tumor reduced for at least 50%, so it was less than 50%, or it was completely gone within the time of the observation, which was between one and three months.

Good ideas about about why this 15% of the tumors did not respond.

Probably due to gap junctions and two cells actually behave as a two separate entities as it's expected.
